title: Fine, here's an unpopular opinion in a more eloquent way: Kalista is way too weak right now.
body:
I hate the boards mentality sometimes. They're not satisfied by fairness and are strictly influenced by what they want rather than what's fair.

http://champion.gg/champion/Kalista/ADC

According to this site, in high level play, Kalista is below a 40% win rate. Love or hate the champion, this is incredibly weak, and I was simply curious whether or not there were any plans in the future to give her some small changes to help bump her back to a decent state in the game.

I don't like playing against Kalista, but regardless of what I like or don't like, I value fair gameplay and balance above wanting a certain champion to be dumpstered just because I dislike playing against it.

So, having said that, are there any pending plans to make her more relevant again? Thanks! :3

replies.body:
I dont think anyone would disagree that kalista sucks.

She hasnt been good for almost a year right?
She needs to be reworked. She absolutely should not be buffed whatsoever considering her current kit.

This.

As long as her kit is what it is I'm happy with her being in the trash.

> kalista is way too weak right now
> unpopular opinion

Choose one.
You can't have an opinion on the board or say anything intelligent without getting downvoted. You should know this by now.
this is good let other champions have a chance to breath

and buying stocks on margin is a dumb ass idea

so what other obvious truths have you discovered ?

I'll say what I usually say in topics like these.

Kalista MUST be intentionally dumpstered in her present form.  If a hard-counter champion who has as much generalist power as Kalista is ever even *passably* decent, then they totally invalidate whole classes of champions.

If Kalista is ever going to be good, she either needs to lose ALL her objective control, map control, and initiation (all her generalist power) to make her a niche hard-counter champion.  OR she needs a new passive.

Of those I think the latter would be better for the game.  A Marksmen focused heavily on objective control is an interesting niche for her to fill.  A Marksmen focused heavily on making people who like melee champs hate the game really isn't.
